intro: Senecio schultzii subsp. schultzii, commonly known as the Schultze's groundsel, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a low-growing perennial herb characterized by its fibrous root system and hairy, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is native to South Africa and thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable conditions.
